text: Fred A. Risser (born May 5, 1927) is an American Democratic politician. He has been a member of the Wisconsin Senate, representing the 26th District since 1962.Biographical page at State Legislature website. His district includes most of the west side and central neighborhoods of Madison. He was a member of the Wisconsin Assembly from 1957 to 1962. Risser has never lost an election and is the longest-serving state legislator in American political history.Frank Bures, "Backstory: The iron man of state politics", The Christian Science Monitor, March 1, 2007.Sen. Risser outraged that Capitol has become an "armed fortress", John Nichols, The Capitol Times, March 3, 2011 Upon the death of New Mexico State Senator John Pinto in May 2019, Risser became the only remaining World War II veteran currently serving as a state legislator in the United States. ==References== Category:1927 births Category:Living people Category:State legislators of the United States Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:Politicians from Madison, Wisconsin Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:University of Wisconsinâ€“Madison alumni Category:Military people from Wisconsin
